column4: Okay... Hypothetical situation: the user who is also the admin and main user of a system wishes to mount a harddisk for porn^H^H^H^Hprivate data. What would be an apropriate mount point under the hierarchy standard?
you can set any mount point
media and mnt are the normal places
but that seems so upcluttering and random.
howso?
/media/private is better
isn't /media for CDs, etc?
you can throw a HD there too
media gets an icon on the desktop and mnt doesnt is the difference
ah, so mnt makes more sense if most users won't have access.
well they will still have access...IF they know where to look
have it mount in YOUR home folder
you could mount it with nouser
then only root can mount it
assuming you have the only root access
so you could a) mount it in your home folder b) -r c) nouser
Hm... nouser sounds sensible. For some reason my NTFS drives are already mounted readable for root only, too.
That's "nouser" in fstab instead of "defaults", right?
i think nouser would require you to "sudo mount </dev/blah>"
yes
you can always tweak it
